title: Judges Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Judges chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Judges Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Judges Chapter 10.

questions.question: Who arose to defend Israel after Abimelech according to Judges 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Tola
questions.explanation: Judges 10:1 states that after Abimelech, Tola the son of Puah arose to defend Israel.

questions.question: How many years did Tola judge Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: 23 years
questions.explanation: Judges 10:2 says Tola judged Israel twenty and three years.

questions.question: After Tola, who judged Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Jair
questions.explanation: Judges 10:3 tells us that after Tola, Jair, a Gileadite, judged Israel.

questions.question: How many sons did Jair have who rode on ass colts?
questions.explanation: Judges 10:4 states Jair had thirty sons who rode on thirty ass colts.

questions.question: Where was Jair buried?
questions.correctAnswer: Camon
questions.explanation: Judges 10:5 says Jair died and was buried in Camon.

questions.question: Which gods did the children of Israel serve that caused them to do evil in the LORD's sight?
questions.correctAnswer: Baalim and Ashtaroth
questions.explanation: Judges 10:6 lists Baalim and Ashtaroth among the gods Israel served.

questions.question: Who oppressed Israel because of their evil deeds?
questions.correctAnswer: Philistines and children of Ammon
questions.explanation: Judges 10:7 states the LORD sold Israel into the hands of the Philistines and children of Ammon.

questions.question: For how many years did the children of Ammon and Philistines oppress Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: 18 years
questions.explanation: Judges 10:8 says they vexed and oppressed Israel for eighteen years.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Ammon fought against Judah, Benjamin, and Ephraim.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Judges 10:9 confirms the children of Ammon passed over Jordan to fight Judah, Benjamin, and Ephraim.

questions.question: What did the children of Israel do when they were oppressed and distressed?
options: They made peace with their enemies
questions.correctAnswer: They cried unto the LORD
questions.explanation: Judges 10:10 states that the children of Israel cried unto the LORD saying they had sinned.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD refused to listen when Israel cried out because they served other gods.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Judges 10:13 says the LORD would deliver them no more because they forsook Him and served other gods.

questions.question: What did the LORD tell Israel to do after He refused to deliver them?
options: Cry unto the gods which they have chosen
Build new altars to the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Cry unto the gods which they have chosen
questions.explanation: Judges 10:14 records the LORD telling Israel to cry unto their chosen gods to deliver them in tribulation.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel repented and put away the strange gods.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Judges 10:16 says Israel put away strange gods and served the LORD.

questions.question: Where did the children of Ammon encamp before fighting Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Gilead
questions.explanation: Judges 10:17 states the children of Ammon encamped in Gilead.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'What man is he that will begin to fight against the children of Ammon? he shall be _____ over all the inhabitants of Gilead.'
questions.correctAnswer: head
questions.explanation: Judges 10:18 records that the man who begins to fight against the children of Ammon shall be head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.

medium.title: Judges Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Judges Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is feeling discouraged about leadership in the church. Based on Judges 10, what biblical truth about godly leadership can you share?
options: God raises leaders who serve faithfully for many years
Leaders are chosen only by popular vote
Leadership is solely about gaining wealth
Leaders do not need to live among the people
questions.correctAnswer: God raises leaders who serve faithfully for many years
questions.explanation: Judges 10:1-3 shows that God raised Tola and Jair to lead Israel faithfully for over 20 years each, demonstrating long-term faithful leadership.

questions.question: How does Judges 10 teach us about the importance of obedience to God’s commands in family and community life?
options: Disobedience leads to suffering and oppression
God rewards only individuals, not communities
questions.correctAnswer: Disobedience leads to suffering and oppression
questions.explanation: Judges 10:6-9 shows that Israel’s disobedience—serving other gods—brought oppression by enemies, teaching the practical consequence of disobedience in community life.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with temptation to serve worldly things instead of God. Based on Judges 10, what biblical truth would encourage persistence in faithfulness?
options: Forsaking God leads to hardship and divine discipline
questions.correctAnswer: Forsaking God leads to hardship and divine discipline
questions.explanation: Judges 10:6-7 and 13-14 reveal that turning away from God results in hardship and that God allows consequences to bring people back to Him.

questions.question: How does Judges 10 encourage believers in prayer during times of distress?
options: God listens and can deliver when we sincerely repent
questions.correctAnswer: God listens and can deliver when we sincerely repent
questions.explanation: Judges 10:10-16 shows Israel crying out to God in repentance and God responding by having mercy and delivering them after they turned from foreign gods.

questions.question: What does Judges 10 teach about humility and confession before God?
options: Confession and admitting sin lead to God's mercy
Sin should be hidden to avoid shame
questions.correctAnswer: Confession and admitting sin lead to God's mercy
questions.explanation: Judges 10:10 and 15 show Israel confessing their sin and asking God to do as He sees fit, illustrating humility that leads to restoration.

questions.question: A believer is feeling overwhelmed by trials. What biblical principle about perseverance through difficulties can be drawn from Judges 10?
options: Endure trials with prayer and return to God
Give up when things get hard
Ignore problems and hope they go away
questions.correctAnswer: Endure trials with prayer and return to God
questions.explanation: Judges 10:8-10 and 16 show that despite oppression, Israel’s crying out to God and turning from sin brought relief, teaching perseverance through faith.

questions.question: How does Judges 10 illustrate the importance of removing harmful influences in spiritual life?
options: Israel put away strange gods and served the LORD, leading to His compassion
Spiritual influences do not affect life
Only priests can remove evil influences
questions.correctAnswer: Israel put away strange gods and served the LORD, leading to His compassion
questions.explanation: Judges 10:16 states that Israel removed foreign gods and served the LORD, whose soul was grieved by their misery, showing the blessing of repentance.

questions.question: True or False: According to Judges 10, God refuses to help those who repent after serving other gods.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 10:13-16 shows God initially expressing anger but ultimately responding to Israel’s repentance by having compassion and delivering them.

questions.question: True or False: Judges 10 shows that God allows consequences for sin but is willing to forgive when people return to Him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The chapter demonstrates God's discipline through oppression (verses 7-9) but also His mercy when Israel repents (verses 10-16).

questions.question: How does Judges 10 teach about the role of community in facing challenges?
options: The people of Gilead gathered to choose a leader to fight their enemies
questions.correctAnswer: The people of Gilead gathered to choose a leader to fight their enemies
questions.explanation: Judges 10:17-18 describes the assembly of Israel and Gilead’s leaders seeking someone to lead them against the Ammonites, highlighting communal responsibility.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The thirty sons of Jair rode on thirty _____ and had thirty cities in Gilead.
questions.correctAnswer: ass colts
questions.explanation: Judges 10:4 specifies that Jair's thirty sons rode on thirty ass colts and had thirty cities called Havothjair.

questions.question: What practical lesson about stewardship can be learned from the leadership of Jair in Judges 10?
options: Leaders should manage resources responsibly for the community
Wealth is only for personal gain
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders should manage resources responsibly for the community
questions.explanation: Jair's sons having thirty cities (Judges 10:4) implies responsible management of land and resources for the benefit of the people.

questions.question: A believer is feeling guilty about past sins. Based on Judges 10, what encouragement regarding God's attitude can you share?
options: God’s soul was grieved for Israel’s misery but He showed compassion when they repented
God is always angry and unforgiving
questions.correctAnswer: God’s soul was grieved for Israel’s misery but He showed compassion when they repented
questions.explanation: Judges 10:16 highlights that though God was grieved by Israel’s sin, He responded compassionately when they turned back to Him.

questions.question: How does Judges 10 remind us about the importance of faithfulness in family and community worship?
options: Serving multiple gods leads to downfall and oppression
It is acceptable to worship many gods
Worship does not affect community life
Only personal faith matters, not communal worship
questions.correctAnswer: Serving multiple gods leads to downfall and oppression
questions.explanation: Judges 10:6-7 shows Israel’s serving many gods led to God’s anger and oppression, emphasizing the need for faithfulness to the LORD alone.

questions.question: What biblical truth about prayer and dependence on God in difficult times is taught in Judges 10?
options: Crying out to God with repentance leads to deliverance
questions.correctAnswer: Crying out to God with repentance leads to deliverance
questions.explanation: Verses 10-16 show Israel’s sincere prayer and repentance led to God’s mercy and promised deliverance.

hard.title: Judges Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Judges Chapter 10.

questions.question: Who arose to defend Israel after Abimelech, and where did he dwell?
options: Tola, in Shamir in mount Ephraim
questions.correctAnswer: Tola, in Shamir in mount Ephraim
questions.explanation: Judges 10:1 states that after Abimelech, Tola the son of Puah, a man of Issachar, arose to defend Israel and dwelt in Shamir in mount Ephraim.

questions.question: How many years did Tola judge Israel according to Judges 10?
questions.correctAnswer: 23 years
questions.explanation: Judges 10:2 clearly states that Tola judged Israel for twenty and three years.

questions.question: What is significant about Jair's sons and their possessions in the land of Gilead?
options: He had 30 sons who rode 30 ass colts and had 30 cities called Havothjair
He had 12 sons who each ruled a tribe
He was childless and adopted leaders
His sons were priests in Shiloh
questions.correctAnswer: He had 30 sons who rode 30 ass colts and had 30 cities called Havothjair
questions.explanation: Judges 10:4 explains that Jair had thirty sons that rode on thirty ass colts and had thirty cities called Havothjair in Gilead.

questions.question: Which gods did the children of Israel serve that caused the LORD's anger to rise?
options: Baalim, Ashtaroth, gods of Syria, Zidon, Moab, Ammon, and Philistines
The gods of Egypt and Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: Baalim, Ashtaroth, gods of Syria, Zidon, Moab, Ammon, and Philistines
questions.explanation: Judges 10:6 lists the various foreign gods Israel served, including Baalim, Ashtaroth, and gods from neighboring nations, which provoked the LORD's anger.

questions.question: For how many years did the Philistines and children of Ammon oppress Israel in Gilead?
questions.correctAnswer: 18 years
questions.explanation: Judges 10:8 states that Israel was vexed and oppressed for eighteen years by the Philistines and children of Ammon in Gilead.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Ammon only fought against the tribes east of Jordan.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 10:9 shows that the children of Ammon crossed Jordan to fight Judah, Benjamin, and Ephraim, not only those east of Jordan.

questions.question: What was Israel's response when they cried unto the LORD after being oppressed?
options: They confessed sin for forsaking God and serving Baalim
They blamed the judges for failure
They sought alliances with foreign gods
questions.correctAnswer: They confessed sin for forsaking God and serving Baalim
questions.explanation: Judges 10:10 records Israel's confession acknowledging their sin in forsaking God and serving Baalim.

questions.question: How does the LORD remind Israel of His past deliverances in Judges 10?
options: By listing their deliverance from Egyptians, Amorites, Ammon, and Philistines
By recounting the creation of the world
By recalling the giving of the Ten Commandments
By mentioning the fall of Jericho
questions.correctAnswer: By listing their deliverance from Egyptians, Amorites, Ammon, and Philistines
questions.explanation: Judges 10:11 reminds Israel how the LORD delivered them from multiple oppressors including Egyptians and Amorites.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The LORD said, 'Go and cry unto the gods which ye have chosen; let them deliver you in the time of your ________.'
questions.correctAnswer: tribulation
questions.explanation: Judges 10:14 quotes the LORD telling Israel to cry to their chosen gods in their time of tribulation.

questions.question: What action did Israel take after acknowledging their sin before the LORD's warning that He would no longer deliver them?
options: They put away strange gods and served the LORD
They built altars to foreign gods
questions.correctAnswer: They put away strange gods and served the LORD
questions.explanation: Judges 10:16 states Israel put away strange gods and served the LORD, prompting His soul to be grieved for their misery.

questions.question: The gathering of the children of Ammon and the assembly of Israel in Mizpeh represents which literary device in Judges 10?
options: Parallelism of opposing camps preparing for battle
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism of opposing camps preparing for battle
questions.explanation: Judges 10:17 uses parallel descriptions of enemy and Israel encamping to set the stage for impending conflict, a form of literary parallelism.

questions.question: Which tribe's princes in Gilead sought a leader to fight the children of Ammon?
questions.correctAnswer: Gilead
questions.explanation: Judges 10:18 records the people and princes of Gilead asking who will lead them against Ammon, indicating their role in leadership selection.

questions.question: How does the repeated cycle of sin and deliverance in Judges 10 reflect the broader Deuteronomistic history theme?
options: It shows Israel's covenant unfaithfulness and God's justice and mercy
It highlights the role of kingship
questions.correctAnswer: It shows Israel's covenant unfaithfulness and God's justice and mercy
questions.explanation: The cycle of sin, oppression, repentance, and deliverance in Judges 10 aligns with the Deuteronomistic theme of covenant fidelity shaping Israel's history.

questions.question: What cultural significance might the riding of ass colts by Jair's sons convey in the ancient Near Eastern context?
questions.correctAnswer: Status and power of leadership
questions.explanation: In Judges 10:4, the detail that Jair's sons rode ass colts symbolizes wealth and authority in the ancient Near East, indicating their high status.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD's refusal to deliver Israel after their sin indicates a final and permanent rejection.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 10:13 and following show God's displeasure but also Israel's repentance and restoration, indicating that deliverance is withheld but not permanently refused.

theological.title: Judges Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Judges Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who arose to defend Israel after Abimelech, judging Israel for twenty-three years?
questions.correctAnswer: Tola the son of Puah
questions.explanation: Judges 10:1-2 states that after Abimelech, Tola son of Puah arose to defend Israel and judged for twenty-three years. This shows God's provision of judges to deliver Israel in times of need, aligning with God's covenant faithfulness seen in Exodus 18:21 and Acts 13:20.

questions.question: How many sons did Jair have who rode on thirty ass colts and controlled thirty cities?
questions.correctAnswer: Thirty
questions.explanation: Judges 10:4 describes Jair having thirty sons who rode on thirty ass colts and had thirty cities. This illustrates the tribal leadership and territorial governance during the judges period, echoing God's order for leadership seen in Numbers 1:44-46 and the principle of stewardship in Luke 12:42-44.

questions.question: Which nations' gods did Israel serve, provoking the LORD's anger?
options: Baalim, Ashtaroth, gods of Syria, Zidon, Moab, Ammon, and the Philistines
questions.correctAnswer: Baalim, Ashtaroth, gods of Syria, Zidon, Moab, Ammon, and the Philistines
questions.explanation: Judges 10:6 shows Israel's idolatry including Baalim, Ashtaroth, and gods of surrounding nations. This highlights the human sin of forsaking the true God, fulfilling the pattern of covenant unfaithfulness seen in Jeremiah 2:11-13 and Romans 1:21-25.

questions.question: For how many years did the Philistines and the children of Ammon oppress Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Eighteen years
questions.explanation: Judges 10:8 records the oppression lasting eighteen years. This period of suffering is part of the cycle of sin, judgment, repentance, and deliverance illustrating God's justice and mercy, as also seen in 2 Chronicles 15:7 and Romans 11:22.

questions.question: Which tribes of Israel were particularly distressed due to the Ammonite attack crossing the Jordan?
questions.correctAnswer: Judah, Benjamin, and Ephraim
questions.explanation: Judges 10:9 states the children of Ammon fought against Judah, Benjamin, and Ephraim, causing great distress. This shows the unity and vulnerability of Israel’s tribes, reflecting the corporate nature of God's covenant people as in Deuteronomy 28:49-50 and Hebrews 3:12-13.

questions.question: What was Israel's confession when they cried unto the LORD in their distress?
options: We have sinned against thee, forsaking God and serving Baalim
We are innocent and seek your help
We will fight on our own strength
We do not know what we have done wrong
questions.correctAnswer: We have sinned against thee, forsaking God and serving Baalim
questions.explanation: Judges 10:10 records Israel's confession of sin, acknowledging their idolatry and forsaking the LORD. This is consistent with the biblical theme of repentance as the way to restoration, emphasized in 1 John 1:9 and Psalm 51:1-4.

questions.question: How did the LORD respond to Israel's plea, reminding them of His past deliverances?
options: He reminded them He delivered them from Egyptians, Amorites, Ammonites, and Philistines
He immediately delivered them without conditions
He told them to fight on their own
questions.correctAnswer: He reminded them He delivered them from Egyptians, Amorites, Ammonites, and Philistines
questions.explanation: Judges 10:11-12 shows God reminding Israel of His past mighty acts of deliverance. This underscores God's covenant faithfulness as revealed throughout Scripture, for example in Exodus 20:2 and Psalm 136.

questions.question: What reason did God give for refusing to deliver Israel again initially?
options: Because they forsook Him and served other gods
Because He wanted to test their faith
questions.correctAnswer: Because they forsook Him and served other gods
questions.explanation: Judges 10:13 explains God's refusal due to Israel's idolatry. This reflects God's righteous judgment against sin, consistent with Deuteronomy 32:16-17 and Ezekiel 14:6-8, showing God's holiness and justice.

questions.question: What did God tell Israel to do after declaring He would not deliver them?
options: Go and cry to the gods they have chosen to deliver them
questions.correctAnswer: Go and cry to the gods they have chosen to deliver them
questions.explanation: Judges 10:14 records God's challenge to Israel to seek help from their idols. This illustrates the futility of idolatry and God's sovereignty, paralleling Isaiah 45:20-22 and Psalm 115:4-8.

questions.question: How did Israel respond after God's challenge regarding their idols?
options: They acknowledged their sin and asked God to do whatever seemed good to Him
They turned to other gods again
questions.correctAnswer: They acknowledged their sin and asked God to do whatever seemed good to Him
questions.explanation: Judges 10:15 shows Israel’s humility and surrender to God's judgment and mercy, a key biblical principle of repentance and trust in God's sovereign will, as seen in Proverbs 3:5-6 and Romans 12:1-2.

questions.question: What significant action did Israel take after confessing their sin and seeking the LORD?
options: They put away the strange gods and served the LORD
They continued to serve Baalim secretly
They asked for a human king
questions.correctAnswer: They put away the strange gods and served the LORD
questions.explanation: Judges 10:16 reveals Israel’s repentance by removing idols and returning to the LORD, demonstrating true repentance consistent with Jeremiah 3:12-14 and 2 Chronicles 7:14.

questions.question: How did the LORD feel about Israel’s misery after they repented?
options: He was angry and punished them further
questions.correctAnswer: His soul was grieved
questions.explanation: Judges 10:16 states God's soul was grieved over Israel’s misery, indicating His compassionate character. This aligns with the biblical depiction of God's loving-kindness and sorrow over sin, as in Isaiah 63:9 and Psalm 78:40-41.

questions.question: Where did the children of Ammon and the children of Israel encamp for the forthcoming battle?
options: Ammon in Gilead, Israel in Mizpeh
Ammon in Mizpeh, Israel in Gilead
questions.correctAnswer: Ammon in Gilead, Israel in Mizpeh
questions.explanation: Judges 10:17 describes the Ammonites encamping in Gilead and Israel assembling in Mizpeh. This strategic positioning reflects the ongoing conflict and God's providence in deliverance, similar to battles in Joshua 10 and 2 Samuel 5.

questions.question: What was the criteria for the man to lead the fight against the children of Ammon according to the princes of Gilead?
options: He shall be head over all the inhabitants of Gilead
He must be from the tribe of Judah
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be head over all the inhabitants of Gilead
questions.explanation: Judges 10:18 shows the princes seeking a man who would lead and unify Gilead in battle. This principle of leadership aligns with biblical teachings on godly authority and unity, as in Exodus 18:21 and Hebrews 13:17.

questions.question: Which attribute of God is primarily revealed by His initial refusal to deliver Israel due to their idolatry?
questions.correctAnswer: God’s holiness and justice
questions.explanation: God’s refusal in Judges 10:13 highlights His holiness and justice in response to sin, consistent with Leviticus 19:2 and Romans 3:23-26 which affirm God’s righteous judgment alongside mercy.

questions.question: Judges 10 teaches that Israel’s repeated cycles of sin and deliverance demonstrate which theological truth?
options: God’s covenant faithfulness and mercy despite human unfaithfulness
That Israel’s salvation depended on their own strength
questions.correctAnswer: God’s covenant faithfulness and mercy despite human unfaithfulness
questions.explanation: The cycle in Judges 10 illustrates God’s enduring mercy and covenant faithfulness despite Israel’s repeated sin, reflecting themes in Psalm 103:8-12 and Lamentations 3:22-23.
